required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study To Assess The Effect Of Linezolid On QTc Interval
clinical_study.official_title: Single Dose Safety, Tolerability And Pharmacokinetics Of Escalating Intravenous Doses Of Linezolid Followed By Evaluation Of The Effect Of Single Intravenous Doses Of Linezolid On QTc Interval In Healthy Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: The FDA has asked Pfizer to assess the risk of linezolid on QT interval (obtained from ECG readings) which could predispose patients to ventricular arrhythmias. This study is conducted to satisfy this requirement.

primary_outcome.measure: Cohort 1: Number of Subjects With Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From the time the subject had taken at least one dose of study treatment up to 5 weeks
primary_outcome.description: All observed or volunteered AEs and SAEs regardless of treatment group or suspected causal relationship to the investigational product(s) were reported.

primary_outcome.measure: Cohort 2: Mean Time-Matched Difference in Time Corresponding to Beginning of Depolarization to Repolarization of the Ventricles, Corrected for Heart Rate Using Fridericia's Formula (QTcF Interval) Between Linezolid 600 mg and 1200 mg Compared to Placebo
primary_outcome.description: The time corresponding to the beginning of depolarization to repolarization of the ventricles (QT interval) was adjusted for ventricular rate (VR) using the QT and VR from each electrocardiogram by Fridericia's formula (QTcF = QT divided by cube root of VR in seconds). A measure of dispersion is not available.

secondary_outcome.measure: Cohort 1: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to Extrapolated Infinite Time (AUC Inf) and Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to Last Quantifiable Concentration (AUC Last)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: predose, 30 minutes, and at 1 (end of infusion), 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, and 46 hours after start of infusion
secondary_outcome.description: AUC inf = Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve from time zero (pre-dose) to extrapolated infinite time. AUC last = Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve from time zero (pre-dose) to time of last quantifiable concentration (0-t).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: predose, 30 minutes, and at 1 (end of infusion), 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, and 46 hours after start of infusion

secondary_outcome.measure: Cohort 1: Time to Reach Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Tmax) and Plasma Decay Half-Life (t1/2)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: predose, 30 minutes, and at 1 (end of infusion), 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, and 46 hours after start of infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma decay half-life is the time measured for the plasma concentration to decrease by one half.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: predose, 30 minutes, and at 1 (end of infusion), 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, and 46 hours after start of infusion
predose, 30 minutes, and at 1 (end of infusion), 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, and 46 hours after start of infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Vss = (mean residence time [The average total time molecules of a given dose spend in the body] extrapolated to infinity) multiplied by CL

secondary_outcome.measure: Cohort 2: Mean Time-Matched Difference in QTcF Intervals Between Moxifloxacin and Placebo
secondary_outcome.description: A measure of dispersion is not available.

secondary_outcome.measure: Cohort 2: Mean Time-Matched Difference in Uncorrected QT Intervals Between Linezolid 600 mg and 1200 mg Compared to Placebo
secondary_outcome.description: A measure of dispersion is not available.

secondary_outcome.measure: Cohort 2: AUC Inf and AUC Last
secondary_outcome.description: AUC inf = Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve from time zero (pre-dose) to extrapolated infinite time. AUC last = Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve from time zero (pre-dose) to time of last quantifiable concentration (0-t).
Plasma decay half-life is the time measured for the plasma concentration to decrease by one half. Tmax is the time to reach Cmax.
Vss = (mean residence time [The average total time molecules of a given dose spend in the body] extrapolated to infinity) multiplied by CL

secondary_outcome.measure: Cohort 2: Number of Subjects With AEs and SAEs
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the time the subject had taken at least one dose of study treatment up to 5 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: All observed or volunteered AEs and SAEs regardless of treatment group or suspected causal relationship to the investigational product(s) were reported.

intervention.description: Intravenous, Placebo control for blinding, Normal Saline, Single dose
Intravenous, Placebo control for blinding, Normal Saline, Single dose

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy male and female subjects between the ages of 21 and 55 years.
- Body mass Index (BMI) of 18 to 30 kg/m2; and a total body weight > 45 kg (99 lbs).
- An informed consent document signed and dated.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Evidence or history of clinically significant abnormality.
- 12-lead ECG demonstrating QTc >450 msec at Screening.
- Receiving selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors (SSRIs) and/or sympathomimetic agents.
- Abnormal liver function tests.
- A positive urine drug screen, history of excessive alcohol and tobacco use.

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

clinical_study.keyword: Linezolid, QTc interval, pharmacokinetics, therapeutic dose, supra-therapeutic dose

group.title: Cohort 1: Sequence 1
group.description: Subjects were randomly assigned to placebo first, then linezolid 900 milligrams (mg) followed by 1200 mg linezolid, after a washout period of 48 hours between doses in Sequence 1.

group.title: Cohort 1: Sequence 2
group.description: Subjects were randomly assigned to linezolid 900 mg first, then placebo, followed by 1200 mg linezolid, after a washout period of 48 hours between doses in Sequence 2.

group.title: Cohort 1: Sequence 3
group.description: Subjects were randomly assigned to linezolid 900 mg first, then 1200 mg linezolid, followed by placebo after a washout period of 48 hours between doses in Sequence 3.

group.title: Cohort 2: Sequence 1
group.description: Subjects were randomly assigned to placebo, then moxifloxacin, followed by linezolid 600 mg and 1200 mg, after a washout period of 48 hours between doses in Sequence 1.

group.title: Cohort 2: Sequence 2
group.description: Subjects were randomly assigned to linezolid 600 mg first, then linezolid 1200 mg followed by placebo and moxifloxacin, after a washout period of 48 hours between doses in Sequence 2.

group.title: Cohort 2: Sequence 3
group.description: Subjects were randomly assigned to linezolid 1200 mg first, then moxifloxacin 400 mg followed by linezolid 600 mg and placebo after a washout period of 48 hours between doses in Sequence 3.

group.title: Cohort 2: Sequence 4
group.description: Subjects were randomly assigned to moxifloxacin 400 mg first, then placebo followed by linezolid 1200 mg and 600 mg linezolid after a washout period of 48 hours between doses in Sequence 4.

group.title: Cohort 1: Placebo, Linezolid 900 mg and 1200 mg
group.description: Subjects were randomly assigned to placebo followed by linezolid 900 mg then 1200 mg linezolid in Sequence 1; or, linezolid 900 mg then linezolid 1200 mg followed by placebo in Sequence 2; or, linezolid 900 mg then placebo followed by linezolid 1200 mg in Sequence 3. There was a washout period of 48 hours between doses.

group.title: Cohort 2: Placebo, Linezolid 600 mg and 1200 mg, Moxifloxacin
group.description: Subjects were randomly assigned to placebo first then moxifloxacin followed by linezolid 600 mg and 1200 mg linezolid last in Sequence 1; or linezolid 600 mg first then linezolid 1200 mg followed by placebo and moxifloxacin last in Sequence 2; or, linezolid 1200 mg first then moxifloxacin 400 mg followed by linezolid 600 mg and placebo last in Sequence 3; or, moxifloxacin 400 mg first then placebo followed by linezolid 1200 mg and 600 mg linezolid last in Sequence 4. There was a washout period of 48 hours between each dose.

outcome.title: Cohort 1: Number of Subjects With Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
outcome.description: All observed or volunteered AEs and SAEs regardless of treatment group or suspected causal relationship to the investigational product(s) were reported.
outcome.time_frame: From the time the subject had taken at least one dose of study treatment up to 5 weeks
outcome.population: Safety Analysis Set (SAS): All subjects who received at least 1 dose of study medication.

group.title: Cohort 1: Placebo
group.description: 600 milliliters (mL) saline as a constant rate intravenous (IV) infusion of 60 minutes.

group.title: Cohort 1: 900 mg Linezolid
group.description: 450 mL Zyvox plus 150 mL saline as a constant rate IV infusion of 60 minutes.

group.title: Cohort 1: 1200 mg Linezolid
group.description: 600 mL Zyvox as a constant rate IV infusion of 60 minutes.

outcome.title: Cohort 2: Mean Time-Matched Difference in Time Corresponding to Beginning of Depolarization to Repolarization of the Ventricles, Corrected for Heart Rate Using Fridericia's Formula (QTcF Interval) Between Linezolid 600 mg and 1200 mg Compared to Placebo
outcome.description: The time corresponding to the beginning of depolarization to repolarization of the ventricles (QT interval) was adjusted for ventricular rate (VR) using the QT and VR from each electrocardiogram by Fridericia’s formula (QTcF = QT divided by cube root of VR in seconds). A measure of dispersion is not available.
outcome.population: The pharmacokinetic (PK) parameter analysis population was defined as all subjects randomized and treated who had at least 1 of the PK parameters of primary interest in at least 1 treatment period.

measure.title: Cohort 2: Mean Time-Matched Difference in Time Corresponding to Beginning of Depolarization to Repolarization of the Ventricles, Corrected for Heart Rate Using Fridericia's Formula (QTcF Interval) Between Linezolid 600 mg and 1200 mg Compared to Placebo

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of < 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), < 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
